title: How to Use Maple Syrup

steps.headline: Make chicken dishes with a sweet twist.
steps.description: Create a maple-bourbon sauce for a classic chicken fajita dish by combining garlic, ketchup, maple syrup, bourbon, soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, and brown sugar in a saucepan.Add 1/4 cup of vegetable oil to a saucepan over medium heat, and stir in 2 cloves of minced garlic. Cook until the garlic is lightly browned. Whisk in 1/4 cup of ketchup, 1/4 cup of maple syrup, 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of bourbon, 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of soy sauce, ⁄2 tablespoon (7.4 ml) of apple cider vinegar, and ⁄2 tablespoon (7.4 ml) of brown sugar. Bring the heat to low and simmer the sauce until thickened.

steps.headline: Drizzle maple syrup over roasted vegetables.
steps.description: A roasted squash dish with sage cream gets a sweet addition with 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of maple syrup. Or, make maple-roasted brussels sprouts for a simple vegetable side dish.Season 2.25 pounds (1.02 kg) of baby brussels sprouts with salt and pepper in a large skillet coated with vegetable oil, and cook them over high heat until browned. Add 4 ounces (110 g) of unsalted butter and 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of brown sugar, cooking over moderately high heat until the sugar is melted. Add 1/4 cup of Grade A maple syrup, stirring occasionally, and cook for about seven minutes. Stir in 1 ⁄2 tablespoons (22.2 ml) of cider vinegar, and add 6 ounces (170 g) of roasted chestnuts and 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of walnut oil. Cook until hot. Transfer the brussels sprouts and chestnuts to a bowl using a slotted spoon. Boil the cooking liquid over high heat for about 2 minutes, and then pour it over the brussels sprouts.

steps.headline: Mix maple syrup into baked beans.
steps.description: Add 1/2 cup of dark grade maple syrup to beans bathed in Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper sauce. Stir in 1/4 cup more after the mixture bakes for a more pronounced maple flavor.

steps.headline: Make maple-seared scallops.
steps.description: Cover 16 10/20 scallops with maple syrup in a small bowl, and season them to taste with salt and pepper. Pour vegetable oil into a small pan over high heat, and add the scallops until they're seared on both sides and the maple syrup has caramelized. Reduce the heat to low and add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of unsalted butter, allowing it to cook into the scallops for one minute.

steps.headline: Mix maple syrup glazes for cakes, buns, and ice cream.
steps.description: Try a maple-glazed pumpkin-cranberry coffee cake for a treat that is both sweet and warmly spiced. For a gooier coating, mix powdered sugar, melted butter, an egg white, and maple syrup for use on maple-pecan sticky buns. Add richness to your vanilla ice cream with a simple maple-walnut sauce.

steps.headline: Infuse crispy rice treats with a luscious maple flavor.
steps.description: Whip together a simple maple-bacon chewy crispy bars recipe by stirring 3 tablespoons (44.4 ml) of maple syrup and 4 slices of cooked and sliced applewood-smoked bacon into 10 ounces (280 g) of melted marshmallows and 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of melted butter. Add 6 cups of rice cereal, and toss to combine. Pour the mixture into a 13x9-inch (33x23-cm) pan coated with cooking spray.

steps.headline: Balance tartness and maple sweetness with fruity treats.
steps.description: Combine maple syrup with mangos and pineapple for a tofu-based tropical pudding.Puree 2 tablespoons of maple syrup, 24 ounces (680 g) of silken tofu, 2 peeled, pitted, and cut mangos, 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/8 teaspoon of salt in a food processor until the mixture is completely smooth. Transfer it to a large bowl. Chop 1/2 of a large pineapple into 1/8-inch (0.32 cm) pieces, and fold them into the pudding. Cover the mixture and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Cook 3/4 cup of unsweetened and shredded coconut over medium heat in a large skillet until golden brown. Remove from skillet and let it cool. Spoon the pudding into bowls and top it with the toasted coconut.

steps.headline: Blend maple syrup into classic cocktail favorites.
steps.description: Use a dark amber syrup to upgrade an old-fashioned into a rich maple-bourbon smash. Substitute regular simple syrup with maple syrup in a mint julep. Stir maple syrup in with vinegar, tequila, rum, rye, Velvet Falernum, and bitters for a riff on the Sazerac.

steps.headline: Cool off with fruity maple-accented punches and teas.
steps.description: Brighten up a pear-apple-cranberry punch with two tablespoons of maple syrup. Spice a pitcher of iced tea with maple syrup for a refreshing drink on a hot day.Boil a kettle of water, and pour it into a pitcher with 6 green tea bags, 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of powdered star anise, 1/4 cup of maple syrup, and 1 sliced lemon. Pour in 6 cups of hot water and let it brew for 5 minutes, and then chill. Fill another pitcher with ice, and pour the tea over it.

steps.headline: Craft delicious maple milkshakes.
steps.description: For a flavorful and low-fat maple-peach shake, blend 1 1/4 cups of low-fat milk, 1 cup of low-fat vanilla frozen yogurt, 6 tablespoons (88.7 ml) of Grade B maple syrup, 1 teaspoon of lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and 14 ounces (400 g) of chopped and peeled frozen peaches in a food processor until smooth.
